text: Khatuna Tskhadadze (, born 3 May 1973) is a Georgian translator and writer. ==Early life and education== Tskhadadze was born in Tbilisi, Georgian SSR, Soviet Union in 1973. In 1996 she graduated from Tbilisi State University. She knows Georgian, Italian, English and Russian languages. ==Career== In 1997 she posted translations of short stories by Gianni Rodari, Italo Calvino and Tonino Guerra. From 2005 to 2010 she translated into Georgian The Name of The Rose, by Umberto Eco, After this she translated more of his books. ==Prizes and awards== * Literary award SABA 2011 for the best translated book: The Name of the Rose, Umberto Eco * Literary award SABA 2015 for the best translated book: Cemetery of Prague, Umberto Eco * Literary award SABA 2017 for the best translated book: Foucault's Pendulum, Umberto Eco ==References== * Biography on Saba * nplg.gov - Web-page of National library of Parliament of Georgia Category:1973 births Category:Translators Category:Writers from Tbilisi Category:Living people
title: Khatuna Tskhadadze
